text: Acritodon nephophilus is a species of moss in the family Sematophyllaceae. It is endemic to Mexico, where it is known only from two locations in Oaxaca. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. It is threatened by habitat loss. Conservation efforts for this species have difficulty protecting local populations due to insufficient attention and legislation regarding preservation of moss species. ==References== Category:Hypnaceae Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Oaxaca Category:Endangered biota of Mexico Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Acritodon nephophilus
